attributes.action: Ban the simlocking of mobile phones.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Simlocking creates an artifical market-environment in which the airtime-provider is able to fix the price and availability of handsets. Often this is an unrealistically low price, but with heavy strings attached such as a long-term contract.  

There is no valid reason for allowing this practice, a practice which almost certainly would be prohibited on any other class of consumer electronic goods. 

Banning simlocking would allow the consumer to buy a mobile phone in the same way as buying a landline phone, without strings attached, and at a known and fixed cost. The airtime contract would then be up to the user, as it is for any other kind of agreement to supply a service.

Belgium, France and the Netherlands impose tight controls on this practice. It's time the UK did likewise.   

We therefore suggest that the practice of simlocking should be banned, and normal market-forces be allowed to determine the price and availability of mobile handsets.
